com.example.notesapplicationv20.adapter

Class NotesAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<VH>
      • com.example.notesapplicationv20.adapter.SelectableAdapter<NotesAdapter.ViewHolder>
        • com.example.notesapplicationv20.adapter.NotesAdapter

  • public class NotesAdapter
extends SelectableAdapter<NotesAdapter.ViewHolder>
    The NotesAdapter class extends SelectableAdapter that defines the logic to make the items of an recyclerView selectable. The class itself defines the logic for the recyclerView that is used to display listed notes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NotesAdapter.ViewHolder
      This inner class contains the logic of a listed item inside the RecyclerView Therefore this class extends RecyclerView.ViewHolder.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateViewHolder

        @NonNull
public NotesAdapter.ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull
                                                            ViewGroup parent,
                                                            int viewType)
        The onCreateViewHolder method is called when RecyclerView needs a new RecyclerView.ViewHolder of the given type to represent an item. This new ViewHolder should be constructed with a new View that can represent the items of the given type. You can either create a new View manually or inflate it from an XML layout file.
        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<NotesAdapter.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        parent - ViewGroup: The ViewGroup into which the new View will be added after it is bound to an adapter position.
        viewType - int: The view type of the new View.
        Returns:
        A new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type
        See Also:
        RecyclerView.Adapter.getItemViewType(int), #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int)

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull
                             NotesAdapter.ViewHolder holder,
                             int position)
        Called by RecyclerView to display the data at the specified position. This method should update the contents of the itemView to reflect the item at the given position.
        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<NotesAdapter.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        holder - ViewHolder: The ViewHolder which should be updated to represent the contents of the item at the given position in the data set.
        position - int: The position of the item within the adapter's data set.

      • setListedNotes

        public void setListedNotes(List<ListedNote> newListedNotes)
        This method will set the listed notes inside this adapter and will notify the data set being changed
        Parameters:
        newListedNotes - List: A list containing the notes to be listed (ListedNote)

      • getItemCount

        public int getItemCount()
        this method implements getItemCount() from RecyclerView.Adapter and returns an Integer representing the item count
        Specified by:
        getItemCount in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<NotesAdapter.ViewHolder>
        Returns:
        mListedNotes.size() if the list that contains notes is not null otherwise 0

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(int position)
        This method removes a single item from the list containing notes and notifies when an item is removed
        Parameters:
        position - the note's position to be removed

        public void removeItems(List<Integer> positions)

        Parameters:
